newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil futures end firm on Brent strength.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil futures end firm on Brent strength.

text.p: IPE Gas oil futures closed higher on Monday as the market played catch-up with crude futures gains late on Friday, brokers said.
The June gas oil contract settled $4.75 higher at $177.75 a tonne, while July Brent was trading 19 cents lower at $20.16 a barrel at 1659 GMT.
"Crude's strength is it's main prop," said one trader.
"It has to be said that most of Europe is out of the market today so it's quite easy to move around," said a second trader. "Even so the overall trend appears to be up."
Most brokers considered the fact that July Brent had held above $20.00 a barrel was a positive sign, although many players wanted to see more volume behind the rise to substantiate the gains.
July Brent futures rose 86 cents late on Friday after funds moved back into the market, propelling it higher.
